filmography.title: Dodsworth
filmography.role_description: A charming British officer who flirts with the wife of a retired American auto magnate during a cruise.
filmography.plot: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a European vacation, where their marriage unravels as she becomes obsessed with youth and social climbing.

filmography.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
filmography.role_description: A gallant British cavalry officer who fights alongside Errol Flynn in the ill-fated military engagement.
filmography.plot: A British major betrays his regiment and his brother by romancing his brother's fiancée, leading to the infamous charge during the Crimean War.

filmography.title: The Dawn Patrol
filmography.role_description: A jovial and courageous WWI fighter pilot who copes with the stress of aerial combat through humor and camaraderie.
filmography.plot: In World War I, two British flying officers must deal with the stress of losing their comrades and the pressure of command.

filmography.title: Wuthering Heights
filmography.role_description: The refined and gentle neighbor who marries Cathy, offering her stability but lacking the fiery passion of Heathcliff.
filmography.plot: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveler the unfortunate tale of lovers Heathcliff and Cathy.

filmography.title: Bachelor Mother
filmography.role_description: The son of a department store owner who mistakenly believes a salesgirl is the mother of an abandoned baby and falls in love with her.
filmography.plot: A woman finds an abandoned baby and is presumed to be the mother, leading to a series of misunderstandings with her boss's son.

filmography.title: Raffles
filmography.role_description: A gentleman cricketer who moonlights as a master jewel thief, charming society while evading Scotland Yard.
filmography.plot: A debonair gentleman thief tries to help a friend pay off a gambling debt by stealing a necklace.

filmography.title: The First of the Few
filmography.role_description: A fictionalized test pilot and friend to R.J. Mitchell, the designer of the Spitfire, serving as the film's narrator.
filmography.plot: The story of the man who designed the Supermarine Spitfire fighter aircraft, which helped win the Battle of Britain.

filmography.title: A Matter of Life and Death
filmography.role_description: A British RAF pilot who cheats death and must argue for his life in a celestial court after falling in love.
filmography.plot: A British wartime aviator who cheats death must argue for his life before a celestial court.

filmography.title: The Bishop's Wife
filmography.role_description: A stressed clergyman who prays for divine guidance and receives help from a charming angel named Dudley.
filmography.plot: An angel in human form enters the life of a bishop in order to help him build a new cathedral and repair his fractured marriage.

filmography.title: Enchantment
filmography.role_description: An elderly general who recalls his tragic romance as a young man while advising his great-niece on love.
filmography.plot: An elderly man recounts a tragic love story from his youth to his great-niece, encouraging her not to make the same mistakes.

filmography.title: Happy Go Lovely
filmography.role_description: A greeting card tycoon who is mistaken for a reporter by a chorus girl, leading to a romantic comedy of errors.
filmography.plot: A chorus girl is hired to pose as the girlfriend of a wealthy businessman to boost her career, but complications arise when she meets the real man.

filmography.title: The Moon Is Blue
filmography.role_description: A rogueish, middle-aged playboy who tries to seduce a young actress, sparking controversy for its 'adult' themes.
filmography.plot: A young woman meets an architect on the observation deck of the Empire State Building and accepts an invitation to his apartment.

filmography.title: Carrington V.C.
filmography.role_description: A war hero who faces a court-martial for misappropriating funds to highlight his superior's incompetence.
filmography.plot: A highly decorated British army officer is court-martialed for taking money from the regimental safe.

filmography.title: Around the World in 80 Days
filmography.role_description: A punctual, stiff-upper-lip English gentleman who wagers he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.
filmography.plot: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

filmography.title: My Man Godfrey
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated butler with a secret past who brings order and sanity to a chaotic, wealthy household.
filmography.plot: A zany heiress hires a man she believes to be a tramp as the family butler, but he turns out to be more than she bargained for.

filmography.title: Bonjour Tristesse
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, hedonistic widower whose carefree lifestyle on the French Riviera is disrupted by his daughter's meddling.
filmography.plot: A teenage girl tries to break up her playboy father's romance with a serious woman, leading to tragic consequences.

filmography.title: Separate Tables
filmography.role_description: A fraudulent military major whose lies about his war record hide a pathetic and lonely reality.
filmography.plot: Several lonely people at a seaside hotel in Bournemouth, England find their lives intersecting.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Guns of Navarone
filmography.role_description: A cynical explosives expert who clashes with his commander during a dangerous mission to destroy German guns.
filmography.plot: A British team is sent to cross occupied Greek territory and destroy the massive German gun emplacement that commands a key sea channel.

filmography.title: 55 Days at Peking
filmography.role_description: The British ambassador who helps organize the defense of the foreign legations during the Boxer Rebellion.
filmography.plot: Diplomats, soldiers, and other representatives of a dozen nations fend off the siege of the International Compound in Peking during the 1900 Boxer Rebellion.

filmography.title: The Pink Panther
filmography.role_description: A suave, aristocratic jewel thief known as 'The Phantom' who is pursued by the bumbling Inspector Clouseau.
filmography.plot: The bumbling Inspector Clouseau travels to Rome to catch a notorious jewel thief before he steals the 'Pink Panther' diamond.

filmography.title: Casino Royale
filmography.role_description: The original James Bond, forced out of retirement to fight SMERSH in this satirical take on the spy genre.
filmography.plot: In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH.

filmography.title: Murder by Death
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated society detective who is invited to a dinner party to solve a murder, spoofing Nick Charles.
filmography.plot: Five famous literary detective characters and their sidekicks are invited to a bizarre mansion to solve an even more bizarre mystery.

filmography.title: Candleshoe
filmography.role_description: A loyal butler who masquerades as various household staff members to hide his employer's poverty.
filmography.plot: A con man tries to find a hidden fortune in a manor house by passing off a street urchin as the owner's long-lost granddaughter.

filmography.title: Death on the Nile
filmography.role_description: A British lawyer and old friend of Hercule Poirot who helps investigate a murder aboard a Nile steamer.
filmography.plot: As Hercule Poirot enjoys a luxurious cruise down the Nile, a newlywed heiress is found murdered on board.

filmography.title: The Sea Wolves
filmography.role_description: A retired British officer in India who joins a covert mission to destroy a German ship during WWII.
filmography.plot: A group of retired British soldiers in India volunteer for a covert mission to destroy a German radio ship in a neutral harbor.
